thread.title: Southern Lights play Friday Night Live at Mardons Social Club
thread.title_full: Southern Lights play Friday Night Live at Mardons Social Club

author: Somerset Guardian
title: Southern Lights play Friday Night Live at Mardons Social Club
text:
Southern Lights play Friday Night Live at Mardons Social Club By Somerset Guardian   Southern Lights Southern Lights play Friday Night Live at Mardons Social Club   
It's the first "Friday Night Live" at Mardons Social Club, on Friday, October 23 – this new venture sees more diverse bands taking to the Mardons stage – bands you wouldn't normally see playing their regular Saturday slots. 
Female-fronted Southern Lights are an exciting new, five-piece, full of energy and passion. 
Covering some of the greatest rock and pop songs from the past four decades, visitors may spot a familiar face – the club's barman Matt Day on guitar. 
Entry is free, so come along and show some support. 
On Saturday, October 24, Mardons welcome back some old friends, as they prepare for a good old knees up – Irish style. 
Acoustic band The Ceili will again be delivering their mix of traditional Irish and Celtic music along with a heavy dose of blarney, from their witty frontman. 
The band is always a popular guest, the well known favourites, Tell Me Ma and Irish Rover are floor filling, crowd pleasers. 
There's creative arrangements of modern songs, along with some random song choices thrown in too. 
Everyone is welcome, entry is free and music kicks off at 9pm.
